Source code for maxaimetadata.maxflow

import os
import time
import mlflow
import atexit
import json
from threading import RLock
from mlflow.tracking import MlflowClient
from mlflow.entities import Metric,Param,RunTag

_MLFLOW_USR = 'MLFLOW_TRACKING_USERNAME'
_MLFLOW_PWD = 'MLFLOW_TRACKING_PASSWORD'
_PROJECT_PROPERTY_NAME = '__maxai_project__'
_GIT_REPO_PROPERTY = "__maxai_repo__"
_GIT_BRANCH_PROPERTY = "__maxai_branch__"
_GIT_COMMIT_PROPERTY = "__maxai_commit__"
_RUN_TYPE = "__maxai_run_type__"
_REGISTERED_MODELS = "__maxai_registered_models__"



[docs]class MaxRun(object):
    """Max.ai Wrapper class for mlflow run"""
    
    def __init__(self,
                 uri,
                 exp,
                 run):
        self.client = MlflowClient(tracking_uri=uri)
        self.uri = uri
        self.exp = exp
        self.run = run
        self.child_runs = []
        try:
            mlflow.start_run(self.run.info.run_id, nested=True)
        except Exception as e:
            pass
        atexit.register(self.end_run)
    

[docs]    def start_child_run(self, name: str = None):
        tags = {'mlflow.parentRunId': self.run.info.run_id}
        if name:
            tags['mlflow.runName'] = name
        run = self.client.create_run(self.run.info.experiment_id, tags=tags)
        run = MaxRun(self.uri, self.exp, run)
        self.child_runs.append(run)
        MaxFlow._activeRuns.append(run)
        return run



[docs]    def end_run(self):
        mlflow.end_run()
        self.client.set_terminated(self.run.info.run_id)
        MaxFlow._activeRuns.pop()

    

[docs]    def set_active(self):
        MaxFlow._activeRuns.remove(self)
        MaxFlow._activeRuns.append(self)

        

[docs]    def log_dict(self, data, file_name) -> None:
        self.client.log_dict(self.run.info.run_id, data, file_name)



[docs]    def log_artifact(self, local_path, artifact_path=None) -> None:
        self.client.log_artifact(self.run.info.run_id, local_path, artifact_path)

    

[docs]    def log_artifacts(self, local_dir, artifact_path=None) -> None:
        self.client.log_artifact(self.run.info.run_id, local_dir, artifact_path)

        

[docs]    def log_figure(self, figure, artifact_file) -> None:
        self.client.log_figure(self.run.info.run_id, figure, artifact_file)

    

[docs]    def log_metric(self, key, value) -> None:
        self.client.log_metric(self.run.info.run_id, key, value)



[docs]    def log_metrics(self, metrics: dict) -> None:
        metric_list = []
        timestamp = int(time.time() * 1000)
        for key,value in metrics.items():
            metric_list.append(Metric(key, value, timestamp, 0))
        self.client.log_batch(self.run.info.run_id, metrics=metric_list)

    

[docs]    def log_param(self, key, value) -> None:
        if type(value)=='str' and len(value) >= 250:
            self.log_dict({key:value}, key)
            value = 'artifact - {}'.format(key)
        else:
            self.client.log_param(self.run.info.run_id, key, value)



[docs]    def log_params(self, params: dict) -> None:
        param_list = []
        for key,value in params.items():
            if len(json.dumps(value)) >= 250:
                self.log_dict({key:value}, key)
                value = 'artifact - {}'.format(key)
            param_list.append(Param(key, json.dumps(value)))
        self.client.log_batch(self.run.info.run_id, params=param_list)

    

[docs]    def set_tag(self, key, value) -> None:
        self.client.set_tag(self.run.info.run_id, key, value)

        

[docs]    def set_tags(self, tags:dict) -> None:
        tag_list = []
        for key,value in tags.items():
            tag_list.append(RunTag(key, value))
        self.client.log_batch(self.run.info.run_id, tags=tag_list)       



[docs]    def log_data(self, feature_view, **kwargs):
        kwargs.update({'feature_view': feature_view})
        self.set_tags(kwargs)



[docs]    def log_model(self, model):
        if model.training_framework == 'spark':
            mlflow.spark.log_model(model.model, model.__class__.__name__)
        elif model.training_framework == 'h2o':
            #logging model using spark flour as h20 models are wrapped using sparkpipeline
            mlflow.spark.log_model(model.model, model.__class__.__name__)
        else:
            raise Exception('Training Framework {} is not currently supported'.format(
                model.training_framework))


    def __del__(self):
        self.end_run()



[docs]class MaxFlow(object):
    """Max.ai Wrapper class for mlflow"""
    
    _activeFlow = None
    _activeRuns = []
    _lock = RLock()
    
    def __init__(self,
                 uri: str = './mlruns',
                 usr: str = None,
                 pwd: str = None):
        if MaxFlow._activeFlow is not None:
            raise Exception("Cannot have more than one active maxflow Session "
                            "Please reuse existing session")
        if (uri is None) or not(isinstance(uri, str)):
            raise ValueError('Uri must be set and must be string type')
        if usr:
            os.environ[_MLFLOW_USR] = usr
        if pwd:
            os.environ[_MLFLOW_PWD] = pwd
        mlflow.set_tracking_uri(uri)
        self.client = MlflowClient(tracking_uri=uri)
        self.uri = uri
        self.exp = None
        self.run = None
        self.repo = None
        MaxFlow._activeFlow = self
    

[docs]    @classmethod
    def get_active_flow(cls):
        if cls._activeFlow:
            return cls._activeFlow
        else:
            raise Exception('No Active MaxFlow Session Available')

    

[docs]    @classmethod
    def get_active_run(cls):
        if cls._activeRuns:
            return cls._activeRuns[-1]
        else:
            raise Exception('No Active runs Available')

    

[docs]    def set_experiment(self,
                       experiment: str,
                       project: str = None,
                       repo_path: str = None):
        with self._lock:
            if not(isinstance(experiment, str)):
                raise ValueError('Experiment name must be string')
            # set exp as active or create a new experiment if missing
            self.exp = mlflow.set_experiment(experiment)
            if project:
                if not(isinstance(project, str)):
                    raise ValueError('project name must be string')
                if _PROJECT_PROPERTY_NAME in self.exp.tags.keys():
                    if self.exp.tags[_PROJECT_PROPERTY_NAME] == project:
                        pass
                    else:
                        raise Exception(
                            'Experiment cannot belong to multiple project. \
                            Experiment is attached to {} project'.format(experiment.tags[_PROJECT_PROPERTY_NAME]))
                else:
                    self.client.set_experiment_tag(self.exp.experiment_id, _PROJECT_PROPERTY_NAME, project)
            if repo_path:
                from git import Repo
                self.repo = Repo(repo_path)
            # Get update experiment
            self.exp = mlflow.get_experiment(self.exp.experiment_id)

            
        


[docs]    def start_run(self,
                  name: str = None,
                  type: str = None,
                  description: str = None):
        with self._lock:
            if self.run and (
                mlflow.get_run(self.run.info.run_id).info.status != "FINISHED"):
                # return already active run
                print("run_id: {}, is already active".format(self.run.info.run_id))
                return MaxRun(self.uri, self.exp, self.run) 
            mlflow.start_run(run_name=name,description=description)
            self.run = mlflow.active_run()
            print("Active run_id: {}".format(self.run.info.run_id))
            tags = {}
            if type:
                tags[_RUN_TYPE] = type
            if self.repo is not None:
                if self.repo.is_dirty(untracked_files=True):
                    self.repo.git.add(all=True)
                    commit = str(
                        self.repo.index.commit(
                            "run_id: {}, experiment: {}, {}".format(
                                self.run.info.run_id, self.exp.name, description
                            )
                        )
                    )
                else:
                    commit = str(self.repo.head.commit)
                tags[_GIT_REPO_PROPERTY] = str(self.repo.remotes.origin.url)
                tags[_GIT_BRANCH_PROPERTY] = str(self.repo.active_branch)
                tags[_GIT_COMMIT_PROPERTY] = commit

            mlflow.set_tags(tags)
            run = MaxRun(self.uri,self.exp, self.run)
            self._activeRuns.append(run)
            return run

    

[docs]    def auto_log(self, log_models=False):
        mlflow.autolog(log_models=log_models, exclusive=True)

 

[docs]    def register_model(self, run = None, recursive=False, run_id:str = None):
        with self._lock:
            if not self.exp:
                raise Exception('Experiment must be set before regustering models')
            path = "runs:/{}/{}/"
            if run is None and run_id is None and self.run is None:
                raise Exception(
                    "Either an active run must be present or exactly one of run or run_id must be set")
            if not run:
                run = MaxFlow._activeRuns[0]
            registered_models = []
            def register(run):
                id = run.run.info.run_id
                name = run.run.data.tags.get('mlflow.runName', None) 
                run_details = mlflow.get_run(id)
                if run_details.data.tags.get('mlflow.log-model.history', None):
                    logged_models = json.loads(run_details.data.tags['mlflow.log-model.history'])
                    for model in logged_models:
                        model_name = self.exp.name + '-' + name + '-' + model['artifact_path']
                        mlflow.register_model(path.format(id, model['artifact_path']), model_name)
                        registered_models.append(model_name)
                if recursive:
                    for run in run.child_runs:
                        register(run)
            register(run)
            try:
                current_registered_models = json.loads(self.exp.tags[_REGISTERED_MODELS])
                registered_models = list(set(registered_models + current_registered_models))
            except KeyError:
                pass
            self.client.set_experiment_tag(self.exp.experiment_id,
                                               _REGISTERED_MODELS,
                                               json.dumps(registered_models))
            # Get update experiment
            self.exp = mlflow.get_experiment(self.exp.experiment_id)

    

[docs]    def get_registered_model(self, stage='None'):
        if not self.exp:
            raise Exception('Experiment must be set before regustering models')
        registered_models = json.loads(self.exp.tags[_REGISTERED_MODELS])
        result = {}
        for model in registered_models:
            result[model] = self.client.get_latest_versions(model, stages=[stage])[0].source
        return result

    

[docs]    def stop(self):
        for run in MaxFlow._activeRuns:
            run.end_run()
        mlflow.end_run()
        MaxFlow._activeFlow = None
